00023 /* OSCL_HAS_GLOBAL_NEW_DELETE - Enables or disables the definition of overloaded
00024  * global memory operators in oscl_mem.h
00025  *
00026  * Release Mode: OSCL_HAS_GLOBAL_NEW_DELETE 0
00027  * Debug Mode: OSCL_HAS_GLOBAL_NEW_DELETE 1
00028  */
00029 
00030 
00031 #if (OSCL_RELEASE_BUILD)
00032 #define OSCL_BYPASS_MEMMGT 1
00033 #define OSCL_HAS_GLOBAL_NEW_DELETE 0
00034 #else
00035 #define OSCL_BYPASS_MEMMGT 1  //Temporarily disabling
00036 #define OSCL_HAS_GLOBAL_NEW_DELETE 1
00037 #endif
00038 
00039 /* PVMEM_INST_LEVEL - Memory leak instrumentation level enables the compilation
00040  * of detailed memory leak info (filename + line number).
00041  * PVMEM_INST_LEVEL 0: Release mode.
00042  * PVMEM_INST_LEVEL 1: Debug mode.
00043  */
00044 
00045 #if(OSCL_RELEASE_BUILD)
00046 #define PVMEM_INST_LEVEL 0
00047 #else
00048 #define PVMEM_INST_LEVEL 1
00049 #endif
00050 
00051 #if(OSCL_HAS_GLOBAL_NEW_DELETE)
00052 //Detect if <new> or <new.h> is included anyplace to avoid a compile error.
00053 #if defined(_INC_NEW)
00054 #error Duplicate New Definition!
00055 #endif //_INC_NEW
00056 #if defined(_NEW_)
00057 #error Duplicate New Definition!
00058 #endif //_NEW_
00059 #endif //OSCL_HAS_GLOBAL_NEW_DELETE
